name: Uma by COMO, Ubud

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the Uma Ubud for 5 nights in July, and it was the best hotel experience we have ever had! Everything about the Uma is perfect: the beautiful surroundings, the simple, eleagant decor, the healthy & delicious meals, the extremely professional & luxurious spa treatments, and the exceptional kindness & attentiveness from the staff. We took advantage of everything there was to offer (morning walks, river rafting, bike riding, daily yoga class, cultural excursions, and simply relaxing by the pool) and loved them all! I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough, and am forever grateful to the wonderful staff for striking the perfect balance of warm, personal attention without being invasive or insincere. It was pure joy to vacation there and I hope to be lucky enough to return someday.
reviews.title: The best experience ever!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the best hotels in this price range in south east Asia. Great rooms, fantastic food and a quite but cool atmosphere. Complimentary Yoga classes in the afternoon with excellent view over the valley and river.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was our first trip to Bali and an unforgettable one. Our stay at Uma Ubud contributed to the wonderful experience.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Uma

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Stayed at the UMA for 2 nights in a terrace room and emerged totally relaxed and recharged.
reviews.title: Can't wait to return to UMA

likes.liked: — huge bathrooms and great outdoor shower
likes.disliked: — Flies by the pool, external drivers used by the hotel to provide transfers keep promoting their services and complaining about lack of income

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Was lucky to catch the hotel in low season, place was utterly serene and prob only saw a handful of other guests around the entire time. Restaurant, poolbar and front desk staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Elegant and Freindly

likes.disliked: — Old School TV with no sound system

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even whilst we were there we were discussing what to write in our TripAdvisor review!
reviews.title: Exceptional!!!

likes.liked: — The serenety was infectious, it was impossible to stay stressed at the Uma!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent the first four nights of our 12 night honeymoon at the Uma Ubud, and never regretted it for a second!
reviews.title: Great hotel but not in Ubud downtown

likes.disliked: — It's situation and the lack of a frequent shuttle service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived around 9pm, exhausted and delirious from an 18 hour journey from London via Singapore, to a very warm welcome. The first thing we noticed was the feeling of peace & calm, as it is set away from the main road into Ubud and once you reach reception you'd think there was nothing else for miles around. Check-in was quick, quiet and easy, and we were then shown to our garden villa (number 29 - recommended!) and were mightily impressed.
reviews.title: Amazing Uma

likes.liked: — Beautiful setting, helpful staff, great location, delicious food, lots of hotel activities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although not a large space, it was beautiful - light shades of distressed white wood, light oak and crisp white linen on a huge canopied bed. The bathroom was lovely with huge sunken bath, plenty big enough for two, and a semi-outdoors shower. Within 10 minutes of arriving we received a delivery of complimentary pink champagne on ice which was delicious and much-needed after the journey!
reviews.title: Very good, but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: As we arrived at night (the sun sets at 6.30pm all year in Bali) we had no idea what views awaited us from our veranda. When we woke the next morning we were awe-struck - we were on the edge of a valley of coconut palms and banana trees with a river rushing through it... so that's what the 'wildlife' noises had been through the night! (tip: if you are woken at night to what sounds like something loudly tapping on glass, don't worry it's actually just a frog in the nearby foliage!).
reviews.title: Very nice but needs updating
Heaven on earth
reviews.text: Uma Ubud is just the perfect hotel for Ubud. You can walk to the city center or just enjoy the beautiful swimming pool and do absolutely nothing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Staff is very very helpful and the breakfast is amazingly good
reviews.title: Loved Uma.

likes.disliked: — Gets kinda dark at night in the property, rock path can get kinda slippery.

reviews.title: Heaven on earth
reviews.text: Excellent hotel with excellent staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at their largest villa - Shambhala Suite - which had our own infinity pool, jacuzzi, outdoor shower (which also converts into a sauna) and a private spa room (which was converted into a bed for the 3rd guest at USD70 a night).
reviews.title: Fantastic
little paradise
reviews.text: The highlight of the whole trip was the resourceful and friendly staff. Always smiling, genuinely happy to see us and always surpassing my expectations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent the middle section of our Balinese honeymoon in Ubud and stayed at lovely Uma. Our "room" was in fact a light and spacious villa with its own terrace, sun lounging area and infinity pool dropping off into the vibrant green jungle that envelopes the complex. It would have been very easy not to leave the suite at all during out stay! But we did venture out - to the chic poolside bar at Uma, or via the hotel shuttle car into Ubud itself. This hotel is a great place to stay if you want a luxurious base from which to explore the fascinating local area.
reviews.title: Lovely Uma

likes.liked: — The suite in which we stayed was amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Uma Ubud was the third stop on our 3 week honeymoon to Bali last July. Of all the hotels in Bali, the Uma Ubud left me the most centered and satisfied with my vacation. If I had left for the airport right after this hotel, I would have felt completely fulfilled. The surroundings are completely zen. The way everything smelled, the way the food tasted, practicing yoga in a studio perched over the river valley, the massages, the delicious drinks, the cool marble floors on your bare feet - it's all just perfect. There may be more posh resorts, or fancier restaurants, or better pools, but this place is just incredibly special. When i think back about our trip to Bali, it's this hotel that gives me the goose bumps.
reviews.title: Zen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant down at the bottom of the resort has just incredible food - everything is organic and extremely well prepared. It's the best mix of upscale resort food with the traditional simple Balinese food. One caveat, we only ate there for breakfast because Ubud has the absolute best restaurants in all of Bali. While in Ubud, you MUST visit a few restaurants - Ibu Oka is the most famous place on the island to eat babi gulung (pig roasted over coconut fire). Oh my god I still dream of it. It's spicy and crispy and completely delicious. Also, make sure you visit Dirty Duck, a Ubud staple in a fabolous rice paddy setting near the Monkey Forest. On the upscale end, we did the tasting menu at Mosaic which was probably the nicest dinner we had on the island - as good as the best French restaurants in Paris. Another highlight was Jazz Cafe, we just chilled listening to some great low key jazz music and eating some pleasant Italian food.
reviews.title: great staff bad management !!!

likes.disliked: — the cupboard in the bathroom !!! what about humidity ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the Ubud area, there is the best shopping in Bali especially for art and furniture. We purchased beautiful hand carved wood furniture from a store called Danoe Furniture near the neighborhood called Mas. We got an amazing deal on beautiful work, although our canopy bed was destroyed in transit. But that doesn't diminish his work! And we bought these two carved masks that would have costs thousands in New York for $100.
reviews.title: Classy boutique hotel, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The bartenders at this hotel were top notch. Stiff drinks, great recommendations, very friendly and not one of them tried to sell us anything (which was very different than other hotels where the bartenders all tried to convince us to pay them for tour guide services).
reviews.title: Flawless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Uma for 2 nights having spent 2 days at another property (see below). Uma is great, large rooms (we had a pool suite), great views accross the valley through the vegetation. The spa is great, very extensive "menu" with lots of innovative treatments. The resort is expansive. There is a main pool in the main area with a bar etc. Had we not been to one down the road for the previous two days, the place would have seemed perfect, but, having seen another place, it is hard not to compare......
reviews.title: Superb Rooms, Spa and Yoga Studio

likes.disliked: — Bit too commercial, not quite an idyllic paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So - positives:
reviews.title: Absolutely the best hotel we have ever stayed in

likes.liked: — Everything but especially staff, food, rooms, pool, bar, view, yoga teacher, yoga venue and treatment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Massive room / suite! We had a Uma Pool Suite, and it was superb. I reckon that the total length of the frontage of the suite was at least 20 metres, This was a massive patio area with outdoor seats looking into the vegetation. Truly amazing. The bathroom had a sunken bath (plenty of room for 2...) and a separate part outdoor shower. The bed was huge, with nets around (not needed as no bugs / massies), but, made for a romantic feel. The pool area was away from the room (you get the idea of the size - and can see on the photos) with two sun beds - great
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: - Fantastic spa - like the normal Bali type thing, but, with some really innovative treatments / body wraps / electric (!!) treatment
reviews.title: A great alternative to the higher priced, better known Ubud hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Amazing Yoga Studia, great view
reviews.title: The absolute best part of our honeymoon

description: Uma by COMO, Ubud is located in central Bali, close to the cultural hub of Ubud with tropical views of temples, rice paddies and the Tjampuhan Valley. The resort’s contemporary Asiatic design is pared down to ensure sunshine flows through interiors, from bedrooms to cooling plunge pools. Kemiri restaurant boasts world-class, healthful cuisine, created with fresh local ingredients, subtle spicing and distinct Balinese flavours. A signature COMO Shambhala Retreat, replete with a range of holistic wellness therapies, help to nurture and relax, while cultural activities, such as visits to artisans, are complemented by a range of outdoor pursuits, including white-water rafting, mountain biking and trekking.
